result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea L. Dalton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
*No credit if revoked*

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrea L. Dalton

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice returned as undeliverable
Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights

3:00 PM cases 21CF1299, 22CF773, 22CM08 called. Defendant Andrea L. Dalton in court.  Attorney James H Krave in court for Andrea L. Dalton.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
In 21CF1299: Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as charged in the Information. 
In 22CF773: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 3 as charged in the Criminal Complaint. 
In 22CM08: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 as charged in the Criminal Complaint. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts pleas. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
As to Count 1 in 21CF1299: Court withholds a finding of Guilt. A 12 month DAGP is filed with and accepted by the Court. 
As to all other Counts: Court finds defendant Guilty. Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 18 months with conditions: 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant to complete Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any recommendations. 
Defendant not to have violent/abusive contact or acts/threats of violence toward anyone. 
Defendant to pay court costs, provide a DNA sample and pay any applicable surcharges.
Status conference on August 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(Cases called at 11:33 AM - 21CF1299, 22CF773, 22CM8)
Defendant Andrea L. Dalton appeared by video.  Attorney James H Krave in court. Attorney Monica Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense believes there is an agreement - offer calls for a DAGP and probation. Will need to address right to preliminary hearing in 22CF773.
Status Conference (possible plea hearing): August 19, 2022 at 3:00 PM (Defendant to appear in person)
Plea hearing on July 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:32 AM Cases called: 21CF1299 & 22CM8. Defendant Andrea L. Dalton in court.  Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Andrea L. Dalton.  Attorney Monica Fallon in court for State of Wisconsin. The parties have an agreement that involves a Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea. Defendant has an appointment with the coordinator on 07/11/22. 

Plea Hearing: 7/21/22 at 11am - via Zoom

2:04 PM cases 21CF1299 and 22CM08 called. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrea L. Dalton not in court.  Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Andrea L. Dalton. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defense requests another date- has had good contact with the defendant and defendant wants to take the most recent offer from the State. Defendant should update their address with the Court if she has relocated to the Madison area. Defendant would need to meet with DAGP coordinator and pay the DAGP fee before a plea can be heard. 
A plea hearing is scheduled for 6/24/22 at 11:30 AM (via Zoom).
Dated 05/03/2022, Letter from Attorney James Krave to Court requesting appearance by Zoom.
Status conference on May 6, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:15 PM Cases called: 21CF1299 & 22CM8 Defendant Andrea L. Dalton appeared by video.  Attorney James H Krave appeared by video for Andrea L. Dalton.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to appear in person. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Not guilty pleas are accepted on all counts in 21CF1299. 20 days to file motions which can be extended for good cause. 22CM8 will continue to ride along. STC: 05/06/22 at 2pm in person.
Hearing on March 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Both files referred to Branch 2 to schedule an ARGN in felony file with misdemeanor file tracking along.
